Articles.Content:
The country of Kerblakistan is greatly pleased to announce to the world the Kerp MKIV orbital vehicle system!

![kerp_mk4.JPG](http://www.capecodtrailriders.com/gallery/albums/userpics/kerp_mk4.JPG)

We had to 'borrow' some technology from other countries, but we finally made it!

!!!

Those coned fuel tanks are so much dead weight! 

You should replace the lowest middle solid rocket booster with a stack of fueltanks/long fueltanks with an rocket engine on the bottom.

How could have you missed that [glow=white,2,3000];\_;[/glow]

> 
> !!!
> 
> Those coned fuel tanks are so much dead weight! 
> 
> You should replace the lowest middle solid rocket booster with a stack of fueltanks/long fueltanks with an rocket engine on the bottom.
> 
> How could have you missed that [glow=white,2,3000];\_;[/glow]

the majority of our rocket technicians are fresh out of farming school. we've lost many kerbonauts during the learning process. our country doesn't have the technical ability to run ideas through a simulator, so we have to just build it and launch. this is why we are so pleased to have built a rocket that will make orbit finally!
Theoretically, nosecones ought to REDUCE drag... Might try a modded nosecone...

> 
> Theoretically, nosecones ought to REDUCE drag... Might try a modded nosecone...

i like the look of a 'completed' spacecraft. even if it adds drag
